cyber-dojo.sh:
rm -f *.class
CLASSES=.:`ls /cucumber/*.jar | tr '\n' ':'`
javac -Xlint:unchecked -cp $CLASSES  *.java
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  java -cp $CLASSES org.junit.runner.JUnitCore `ls -1 *Test*.class | grep -v '\\$' | sed 's/\(.*\)\..*/\1/'`
fi
hear_shout.feature:
Feature: Hear Shout

  Shouts have a range of approximately 1000m

  Scenario Outline: Only in range shout is heard
    Given Lucy is at 0, 0
    And Sean is at <seans-loc>
    When Sean shouts
    Then Lucy should <what-lucy-hears>
    
    Examples: In range
      | seans-loc | what-lucy-hears |
      | 0, 900    | hear Sean       |
      | 0, 800    | hear Sean       |
      | 900, 10   | hear Sean       |
      | 500, 800  | hear Sean   |

    Examples: Out of range
      | seans-loc | what-lucy-hears |
      | 800, 800  | not hear Sean   |
      | 800, 700  | not hear Sean   |

  Scenario: Out of range shout is not heard
    Given Lucy is at 0, 0
    And Sean is at 800, 800
    When Sean shouts
    Then Lucy should not hear Sean

  Scenario: Multiple shouts from one perosn
    Given Lucy is at 0, 0
    And Sean is at 0, 500
    When Sean shouts
    And Sean shouts
    Then Lucy should hear 2 shouts from Sean

  Scenario: Multiple shouters
    Given people are located at:
      | name  |    x |   y |
      | Lucy  |    0 |   0 |
      | Sean  |    0 | 500 |
      | Oscar | 1100 |   0 |
    When Sean shouts
    And Oscar shouts
    Then Lucy should not hear Oscar
    But Lucy should hear Sean

  Scenario: Lucy doesn't hear herself
    Given Lucy is at 0, 0
    When Lucy shouts
    Then Lucy should not hear Lucy
